revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=August 2015}} {{Infobox comic book title |title = Creature Academy |image = Creature_Academy_collected_edition.jpg |imagesize = 250 |caption = |schedule = Irregular |limited = y |SciFi = y |Fantasy = y |publisher = [[Red 5 Comics]] (through [[ComiXology]]) |date = October 2013 |startmo = |startyr = |endmo = |endyr = |issues = 4 |main_char_team = |writers = [[Kevin Hanna]]
[[David Fagan]] |artists = Kevin Hanna
[[Erich Owen]]
[[Grant Bond (cartoonist)|Grant Bond]]
[[Karen Krajenbrink]]
[[Mirana Reveier]]
[[Brian Thies]] |pencillers = |inkers = |letterers = |colorists = |editors = [[Daniel Solem]]
[[Olga Nunes]] |creative_team_month = |creative_team_year = |creators = |TPB = Creature Academy |ISBN = 978-0-615-92033-7 |subcat = |sort = Creature Academy |website = http://frogchildren.com/wp/creature-academy-the-legacy/ }} '''''Creature Academy''''' is an [[Marvel Rating System|all-ages]]/[[Science fiction comics|science fiction]]/[[Fantasy comics|fantasy]] [[digital comic]] [[Limited series (comics)|series]] created by [[Kevin Hanna]], that ran for four issues and was published in a collected edition for the first time in 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.comicbookresources.com/?page=preview&id=21561 |title=PREVIEW: CREATURE ACADEMY: THE LEGACY OGN |publisher=[[Comic Book Resources]] }} In 2008, [[LeftJet]] announced that they had taken steps for a possible future film adaptation;{{cite web|url=http://www.icv2.com/articles/news/12841.html|title='Creature Academy' Film Gets Financing From Telefilm Canada |work=ICV2|accessdate=July 2, 2008 }} The film, ''The Creature Academy'', is currently in preproduction. ==Plot== ''Creature Academy'' tells the story of rebellious teen, Wes Mendes, who has lived his life on the run with his mother. Once she is kidnapped by ghost-like specters, they then return for him. He must now hide in the under-city; where the human and the magic worlds intersect. There Wes joins a team of students and their mythical creatures.{{cite web|url=http://www.comicosity.com/red-5s-digital-first-ogn-creature-academy-hits-comixology/ |title=PREVIEW: Red 5’s Digital First OGN CREATURE ACADEMY Hits comiXology|work=comicosity.com }} The events of the books predominantly take place in [[Seattle]], [[Washington (state)|Washington]]. * The Undercity: The hidden city underneath Seattle where magic users and mythical creatures hide from the top world * The Academy: The school where magic users are trained to summon and tame mythical creatures ==Characters== Wes Mendes is the [[protagonist]], a young teen learning how to live in a world of adults and magic. The character's name, like all the characters in the book, are from two directors, like [[Wes Anderson]] and [[Sam Mendes]].{{cite web|url= http://herohour.com/articles/creator-speak-kevin-hanna/|title=Creator Speak: Kevin Hanna |work=CBR|accessdate=May 30, 2007 }} ==Collected editions== The series has been collected into a hardcover [[trade paperback (comics)|volume]] ''Creature Academy'' in 2014 by [[Red 5 Comics]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fandompost.com/2014/05/07/comixology-sets-new-notable-digital-comics-manga-for-week-of-may-5th-2014/ |title=ComiXology Sets New & Notable Digital Comics & Manga For Week Of May 5th, 2014|work=fandompost.com}} ==Awards== ''Creature Academy'' graphic novel won the Moonbeam Award and Graphic Novel of the Year at Book Expo America by ''[[ForeWord (magazine)|ForeWord]]'' magazine.{{citation needed|date=August 2015}} ==Film adaptation== The film ''[[Creature Academy (film)|Creature Academy]]'' is currently in the early stages of pre-production.{{cite web|author=from Frogchildren Studios 1 year ago Not Yet Rated |url=http://vimeo.com/52582122 |title=Creature Academy: The Legacy on Vimeo |publisher=Vimeo.com |date=2012-10-31 |accessdate=2013-12-21}} ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{wikiquote}} * {{official website|http://frogchildren.com/wp/creature-academy-the-legacy/}} * [http://www.thepunkettes.com/2012/09/clockwork-girls-kevin-hanna-kickstarts.html Clockwork Girl's Kevin Hanna kickstarts 'Creature Academy']. The Punkettes, September 3, 2012 * {{cite web |first=James |last=Fudge |url=http://www.gamepolitics.com/2015/03/18/artist-claims-kabam-copied-his-ip-create-its-mobile-game-creature-academy#.VcV1sUb6Xlh |title=Artist claims Kabam copied his IP to create its mobile game 'Creature Academy' |publisher=[[GamePolitics.com]] |date=March 18, 2015 |accessdate= }} * {{cite web |first=James |last=Fudge |url=http://www.gamepolitics.com/2015/03/19/kabams-creature-academy-mobile-games-no-longer-available#.VcV1r0b6Xlg |title=Kabam's 'Creature Academy' mobile games no longer available |publisher=GamePolitics.com |date=March 19, 2015 |accessdate= }} [[Category:2013 comics debuts]] [[Category:Animated films based on comics]] [[Category:2013 films]]

{{for|the 1998 film starring Clive Owen|Croupier (film)}} [[Image:Croupier de Hold'em Poker.jpg|thumb|A croupier deals cards for a game of [[Texas hold 'em]]]] A '''croupier''' or '''dealer''' is someone appointed at a [[gambling]] table to assist in the conduct of the game, especially in the distribution of bets and payouts. Croupiers are typically employed by [[casino]]s.
==Origin of the word== Originally a "croupier" meant one who stood behind a gambler, with extra reserves of cash to back him up during a gambling session. The word derived from "croup" (the [[rump (animal)|rump]] of a horse) and was by way of analogy to one who rode behind on horseback. It later came to refer to one who was employed to collect the money from a gaming-table.<ref>[[Oxford English Dictionary]], ''Croupier''</ref>
Originally a 'dealer' meant one who the person responsible for distributing cards or the player in the dealer position, regardless of whether or not that player is responsible for distributing the cards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dictionary.pokerzone.com/dealer|title=Definition of Dealer - PokerZone|website=dictionary.pokerzone.com}}</ref>
== Training == Training methods to become a casino croupier vary from country to country. In North America, [[blackjack]] is almost always the game that dealers learn first, as it is simple and popular, and when the dealer makes errors, they tend not to cost the casino much money. In Europe, croupiers tend to learn [[roulette]] first. Complex, busy games such as [[craps]], with complicated payout systems, etc., are usually reserved for the most competent and/or ambitious dealers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://jobboomcc.canoe.ca/News/2005/10/19/1269228-sun.html|title=Career advice - Job tips for workers and job seekers - Jobboom -|website=Career advice - Job tips for workers and job seekers - Jobboom}}</ref>
== Licensing == [[United States|American]], [[Australia]]n and [[United Kingdom|British]] croupiers are required to apply for a gambling license. This license includes police background checks and credit rating checks, to help determine if they are eligible to commence employment. Croupiers are not permitted to deal at a casino until being issued this license.
== Tipping == As is common with customer service staff in the United States, croupiers there depend on tips to make their wage worthwhile. While a croupier should theoretically have no personal interest in the outcome of the game, a successful player customarily tips the croupier, especially in American casinos. Tips are often pooled and divided amongst all the staff. Fraternising with customers is frowned upon, and most casinos prevent their gambling staff from being seen smoking or even being seen in uniform outside the casino. Some gambling strategies include suggestions to tip the casino dealer in order to create a good atmosphere and improve dealer's mood. According to these strategies, tipping might even make the dealer shuffle the cards less frequently and thereby allow easier tracking of particular cards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://casinoobserver.com/casino-news-item-article-ground-casino-rules.htm|title=Land Casino rules |publisher=casinoobserver.com |accessdate=2010-09-25}}</ref> Australian casinos forbid dealers from taking tips.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.starcity.com.au/Casino__Top_Level_.html|title=Casino|accessdate=2011-07-25}}{{dead link|date=August 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref>
==Secondhand smoke exposure== Because casinos tend to allow smoking on the gambling floor, American croupiers are exposed to [[secondhand smoke]]. A [[Health Hazard Evaluation Program|health hazard evaluation]] of several [[Las Vegas Strip|Las Vegas]] casinos showed that nonsmoker croupiers suffered from more respiratory ailments than their administrative counterparts at the casinos and had [[cotinine]] and [[NNAL]] (both components of secondhand smoke) in their urine samples.<ref>West, Christine. [https://www.cdc.gov/niosh/blog/nsb061609_casino.html Secondhand Smoke and Casino Dealers]. National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health. June 16, 2009.</ref> [[United Kingdom|Britain]] banned smoking in all public places, including casinos, in 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/health/4375478.stm|title=Smoke ban bill details released|date=27 October 2005|publisher=|via=news.bbc.co.uk}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Poker dealer]]
==References== {{reflist|30em}}
==External links== *[http://www.cardplayer.com/poker-news/7160-wsop-a-day-in-the-life-of-a-dealer Card Player magazine Day in the life story]
[[Category:Personal care and service occupations]] [[Category:Gambling terminology]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox video game |title = Dun Darach |image = [[Image:Dun darach cover.jpg|frameless|Dun Darach]] |caption = Spectrum cover art |developer = Greg Follis, Roy Carter |publisher = [[Gargoyle Games]] |designer = |released = {{vgrelease|EU|1985}} |genre = [[Arcade adventure]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] |platforms = [[ZX Spectrum]], [[Amstrad CPC]] }}
'''''Dun Darach''''' is an [[arcade adventure]] published in 1985 by [[Gargoyle Games]] for the [[ZX Spectrum]] and [[Amstrad CPC]] computers.
The background history is based on [[Celt]]ic folklore about the hero [[Cuchulainn]], and his battles against the people of [[Connachta]] in ancient [[Ireland]]. "Dun Darach" or "Dún na nDarach" means "Oak Fort" in the [[Irish language]]. The game is a [[prequel]] to the 1984 game ''[[Tir Na Nog (game)|Tir Na Nog]]'' as the story takes place before that game, when Cuchulainn was still alive.
==Plot== <!-- Commented out: [[Image:Crash18.PNG|thumb|left|An unofficial piece of artwork created by [[Oli Frey]], which was used for the July '85 cover of [[Crash (magazine)|''CRASH'']] (and re-used in 1990<ref>[https://archive.org/stream/crash-magazine-76/Crash_76_May_1990#page/n0/mode/1up]</ref>)]] -->
One day Cuchulainn was travelling home from a battle with the Connachta with his companion Loeg the charioteer. On the way, they stopped off at an [[inn]] and Loeg was persuaded to help a beautiful young woman named Skar whose [[chariot]] was damaged. Cuchulainn took refreshment at the inn and on leaving realised Loeg was missing. He later discovered that Skar is a sorceress and ally of the Connachta and had taken Loeg to the timeless Secret City of Dun Darach in retribution for the death of Prince Amhair. Cuchulainn went on a long search for the mysterious city and eventually discovered it and entered Dun Darach to find Loeg.<ref>[http://www.crashonline.org.uk/18/darach.htm CRASH 18 - Dun Darach]</ref>
==Gameplay== ''Dun Darach'' is an [[arcade adventure]] with interface and presentation nearly identical to ''Tir Na Nog'' or ''[[Marsport]]'' based on collecting objects, solving puzzles based on word puns or lateral thinking and interacting with other characters wandering through the city. The animation is in the same standard as ''Tir Na Nog'', although there is no [[parallax scrolling]]. Since the game can take many hours to complete, there is support for saving its state to [[cassette tape]].
''Dun Darach'' improves over its predecessor in that other characters can give short hints to the player, rob him, and confiscate his belongings if he carries stolen goods. The player can also now buy, steal and sell goods from the many shops in the city, bet at a casino (Iomain Ludum) and even deposit money at a bank with daily [[compound interest]]. The city of Dun Darach is large and consists of different quarters with shops and the current time of the day is indicated by torches in the wall and by the greetings of characters. There is a "blank" area in the centre of the city in Iomain, the pleasure quarter; this was originally intended to be a [[brothel]] called "Lady Q's" and would have opened into a whole [[red-light district]] (this was censored and all that remains is a sign saying "Forbidden").<ref>[http://www.sincuser.f9.co.uk/044/htsquad.htm Sinclair User 44 - Interview with Gargoyle Games] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120131205915/http://www.sincuser.f9.co.uk/044/htsquad.htm |date=2012-01-31 }}</ref> Cuchulainn can move north, south, east and west with the player "rotating" the view using the keyboard and then having Cuchulainn move left or right on the screen, so only one side of the street is visible at once.
==Reception== The ZX Spectrum version was also voted number 57 in the ''[[Your Sinclair]] Official Top 100 Games of All Time''.<ref>{{cite journal|title=Top 100 Games of All Time|journal=Your Sinclair|date=September 1993}}</ref>
==References == {{Reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.mobygames.com/game/dun-darach ''Dun Darach''] at [[MobyGames]] * [http://www.gamefaqs.com/cpc/940595-dun-darach ''Dun Darach''] at [[GameFAQs]] * {{WoS game|id=0001538}}

revision.comment: /* Development */ made accurate current status and added shutdown info
''Understand'' is a weak turn of phrase when we are refering to a mere perception.
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2016}} {{Use British English|date=August 2016}}<!---Citations given in MLA author-date system---> [[File:Bundesarchiv Bild 183-W0409-300, Bertolt Brecht.jpg|thumb|200px|[[Bertolt Brecht]] in 1954]] '''Epic theatre''' ({{lang-de|episches Theater}}) is a theatrical [[Art movement|movement]] arising in the [[Twentieth-century theatre|early to mid-20th century]] from the theories and practice of a number of [[theatre practitioner]]s who responded to the political climate of the time through the creation of a new [[political theatre]]. Epic theatre is not meant to refer to the scale or the scope of the work, but rather to the form that it takes. Epic theatre emphasizes the audience's perspective and reaction to the piece through a variety of techniques that deliberately cause them to individually engage in a different way.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=Brecht|last=Barnett|first=David|publisher=Bloomsbury Publishing Plc|year=2015|isbn=|location=|pages=}}</ref> The purpose of epic theatre is not to encourage an audience to suspend their disbelief, but rather to force them to think introspectively about the particular moments that are occurring on stage and why they are happening a certain way.<ref name=":0" />
==Famous Practitioners==
* [[Erwin Piscator]] * [[Vladimir Mayakovsky]] * [[Vsevolod Meyerhold]] * [[Bertolt Brecht]]
== History ==
The term "[[Epic poetry|epic]] theatre" comes from Erwin Piscator who coined it during his first year as director of Berlin's (1924–27).<ref name="Wiles">Wiles (1980).<!---Needs page number for citation---></ref> Piscator aimed to encourage playwrights to address issues related to "contemporary existence." This new subject matter would then be staged by means of documentary effects, audience interaction, and strategies to cultivate an objective response.<ref>Innes (1972).<!---Needs page number for citation---></ref> Epic theatre incorporates a mode of acting that utilises what Brecht calls ''[[gestus]]''. One of Brecht's most-important [[Marxist aesthetics|aesthetic]] innovations prioritised ''[[Refunctioning|function]]'' over the sterile opposition between ''form'' and ''content''.<ref name="willett281">Willett (1964) 281.</ref> Epic theatre and its many forms is a response to [[Richard Wagner]]'s idea of "[[Gesamtkunstwerk]]", or "total artwork", which intends each piece of art is composed of each other art form.<ref>{{Cite book|title=Leitmotiv and Drama|last=Brown|first=Hilda Meldrum|publisher=Clarendon Press|year=1991|isbn=|location=Oxford|pages=}}</ref> Since epic theatre is so focused on the specific relationship between form and content, these two ideas contradict each other, despite the fact that Brecht was heavily influenced by Wagner. Brecht discussed the priorities and approach of epic theatre in his work "[[A Short Organum for the Theatre]]".<ref name="Organum">Brecht (1949, 276).</ref> Although many of the concepts and practices involved in Brechtian epic theatre had been around for years, even centuries, Brecht unified them, developed the approach, and popularised it.
Near the end of his career, Brecht preferred the term "dialectical theatre" to describe the kind of theatre he pioneered. From his later perspective, the term "epic theatre" had become too formal a concept to be of use anymore. According to [[Manfred Wekwerth]], one of Brecht's directors at the [[Berliner Ensemble]] at the time, the term refers to the "'[[Dialectics#Marxist dialectics|dialecticising]]' of events" that this approach to theatre-making produces.<ref name="willett282">Quoted by Willett (1964) 282.</ref>
Epic theatre is distinct from other forms of theatre, particularly the early [[Naturalism (theatre)|naturalistic]] approach and later "[[Realism (theatre)|psychological realism]]" developed by [[Konstantin Stanislavski]]. Like Stanislavski, Brecht disliked the shallow spectacle, manipulative plots, and heightened emotion of [[melodrama]]; but where Stanislavski attempted to engender real human behaviour in acting through the techniques of [[Stanislavski's system]] and to absorb the audience completely in the fictional world of the play, Brecht saw this type of theatre as escapist. Brecht's own social and political focus was distinct, too, from [[surrealism]] and the [[Theatre of Cruelty]], as developed in the writings and dramaturgy of [[Antonin Artaud]], who sought to affect audiences viscerally, psychologically, physically, and irrationally. While both produced 'shock' in the audience, epic theatre practices would also include a subsequent moment of understanding and comprehension.
==Techniques== ===Verfremdungseffekt=== While not invented by Brecht, the [[Distancing effect|Verfremdungseffekt]], known in English as the "estrangement effect" or the "alienation effect", was made popular by Brecht and is one of the most significant characteristics of Epic theatre.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Schall|first1=Ekkehard|title=The Craft of Theatre: Seminars and Discussions in Brechtian Theatre|date=2015|publisher=Bloomsbury Publishing|isbn=9781474243308|page=205}}</ref>
Some of the ways the Verfremdungseffekt can be achieved is by having actors play multiple characters, rearrange the set in full view of the audience, and "break the fourth wall" by speaking to the audience. The use of a narrator in [[The Caucasian Chalk Circle]] is another example of Verfremdungseffekt at work.<ref name=":0" /> Lighting can also be used to emulate the effect. For example, flooding the theatre with bright lights (not just the stage) and placing lighting equipment on stage can encourage the audience to fully acknowledge that the production is merely a production instead of reality.
As with the principle of [[Dramaturgy|dramatic construction]] involved in the epic form of spoken drama amalgamated or what Brecht calls "[[non-Aristotelian drama]]", the epic approach to play production utilizes a [[Soviet montage theory|montage]] technique of fragmentation, contrast and contradiction, and [[Interruptions (epic theatre)|interruptions]]. While the French playwright [[Jean Genet]] articulates a very different [[world view]] in his dramas from that found in Brecht's, in a letter to the [[Theatre director|director]] [[Roger Blin]] on the most appropriate approach to staging his ''[[The Screens]]'' in 1966, he advises an epic approach to its production:
{{cquote|Each scene, and each section within a scene, must be perfected and played as rigorously and with as much discipline as if it were a short play, complete in itself. Without any smudges. And without there being the slightest suggestion that another scene, or section within a scene, is to follow those that have gone before.<ref>Genet (1966, 25).</ref>|20px|20px}}
===Historicisation=== Historicisation is also employed in order to draw connections from a historical event to a similar current event. This can be seen in the plays [[Mother Courage and Her Children]] and [[The Good Person of Szechwan]], both written by Brecht, which comment on a current social or political issue using historical contexts. <ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bl.uk/20th-century-literature/articles/brecht-interruptions-and-epic-theatre|title=Brecht, interruptions, and epic theatre|last=Gordon|first=Robert|date=7 September 2017|website=British Library|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
Brecht, too, advised treating each element of a play independently, like a [[music hall]] turn that is able to stand on its own. Common production techniques in epic theatre include a simplified, non-realistic [[scenic design]] offset against a selective realism in costuming and props, as well as announcements or visual captions that interrupt and summarize the action. Brecht used [[Comedy (drama)|comedy]] to [[Distancing effect|distance]] his audiences from the depicted events and was heavily influenced by musicals and fairground performers, putting music and song in his plays.
Acting in epic theatre requires actors to play characters believably without convincing either the audience or themselves that they have "become" the characters. This is called Gestus, when an actor takes on the physical embodiment of a social commentary. Actors frequently address the audience directly out of character ("breaking the [[fourth wall]]") and play multiple roles.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bl.uk/20th-century-literature/articles/brecht-interruptions-and-epic-theatre|title=Brecht, interruptions, and epic theatre|last=Gordon|first=Robert|date=7 September 2017|website=British Library|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> Brecht thought it was important that the choices the characters made were explicit, and tried to develop a style of acting wherein it was evident that the characters were choosing one action over another. For example, a character could say, "I could have stayed at home, but instead I went to the shops." This he called "fixing the [[Not / But]] element".
==See also== {{Div col}} * [[7:84]] * [[Augusto Boal]] * [[Bertolt Brecht]] * [[Howard Brenton]] * [[Caryl Churchill]] * [[Distancing effect]] * [[David Edgar (playwright)]] * [[Epic Theatre Ensemble]] * [[Experimental theatre]] * [[Dario Fo]] * [[Gestus]] * [[Joan Littlewood]] * [[Vladimir Mayakovsky]] * [[John McGrath (playwright)]] * [[Modernism]] * [[Erwin Piscator]] * [[Political theatre]] * [[Franca Rame]] * [[Theatre of the Oppressed]] * [[Theatre Workshop]] {{Div col end}}
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==Sources== {{refbegin|2}} * [[Robert Gordon (academic) | Gordon, Robert]]. 2017. "[[Brecht, interruptions, and epic theatre]]". * [[Bertolt Brecht|Brecht, Bertolt]]. 1949. "[[A Short Organum for the Theatre]]". Trans. John Willett. In Brecht (1964, 179-205). * [[Bertolt Brecht|Brecht, Bertolt]]. 1964. ''Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an Aesthetic''. Ed. and trans. John Willett. British edition. London: Methuen. {{ISBN|0-413-38800-X}}. USA edition. New York: Hill and Wang. {{ISBN|0-8090-3100-0}}. * [[Bertolt Brecht|Brecht, Bertolt]]. 1965. ''[[Messingkauf Dialogues|The Messingkauf Dialogues]]''. Trans. John Willett. Bertolt Brecht: Plays, Poetry, Prose Ser. London: Methuen, 1985. {{ISBN|0-413-38890-5}}. * [[Jean Genet|Genet, Jean]]. 1966. ''Letters to Roger Blin''. In ''Reflections on the Theatre and Other Writings''. Trans. Richard Seaver. London: Faber, 1972. 7–60. {{ISBN|0-571-09104-0}}. * Innes, Christopher. 1972. ''Erwin Piscator's Political Theatre: The Development of Modern German Drama''. New edition. Cambridge: Cambridge UP, 1977. {{ISBN|0-521-29196-8}}. * Wiles, Timothy. 1980. ''The Theatre Event.'' Chicago: Chicago University Press. {{ISBN|0-226-89801-6}}. * [[John Willett|Willett, John]]. 1964. Editorial notes. In ''Brecht on Theatre: The Development of an Aesthetic'', by Bertolt Brecht. London: Methuen. {{ISBN|0-413-38800-X}}. New York: Hill and Wang. {{ISBN|0-8090-3100-0}}. {{refend}}
==External links== * [http://www1.usq.edu.au/artsworx/schoolresources/goodwomanofszechwan/epictheatre.htm Epic Theatre] – [[University of Southern Queensland]] Artsworx Resources on ''[[The Good Person of Szechwan|The Good Woman of Setzuan]]''.

{{More citations needed|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox company |name = Fighting Network Rings |logo = Fighting Network Rings.jpg |logo_size = 200px |type = Private |foundation = 1991 (professional wrestling)
1995 (mixed martial arts) |founder = [[Akira Maeda]] |industry = [[Mixed Martial Arts]] promotion |parent = |sibling = |company_slogan = |homepage = |location_city = |location_country= |key_people = Akira Maeda | defunct = }} '''Fighting Network Rings''', trademarked as '''RINGS''', is a Japanese [[combat sport]] promotion that has lived three distinct periods: [[puroresu]] promotion from its inauguration to 1995, [[mixed martial arts]] promotion from 1995 to its 2002 disestablishment, and the revived mixed martial arts promotion from 2008 onward. RINGS was founded by [[Akira Maeda]] on May 11, 1991, following the dissolution of [[Universal Wrestling Federation (Japan)|Newborn UWF]]. At that time, Maeda and [[Mitsuya Nagai]] were the only two people to transfer from UWF, wrestlers such as [[Kiyoshi Tamura]], [[Hiromitsu Kanehara]] and [[Kenichi Yamamoto (mixed martial artist)|Kenichi Yamamoto]] would later also transfer from UWF International. ==Tournaments== ===Mega Battle Tournament=== *Mega Battle Tournament 1992 (Oct 29, 1992 – Jan 23, 1993) – [[Chris Dolman]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1993 (Oct 23, 1993 – Jan 21, 1994) – [[Akira Maeda]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1994 (Sep 21, 1994 – Jan 25, 1995) – [[Volk Han]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1995 (Oct 21, 1995 – Jan 24, 1996) – [[Akira Maeda]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1996 (Oct 25, 1996 – Jan 22, 1997) – [[Volk Han]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1997 (Oct 25, 1997 – Jan 21, 1998) – [[Kiyoshi Tamura]] *Mega Battle Tournament 1998 (Oct 23, 1998 – Jan 23, 1999) – Team [[Netherlands]] ===King of Kings=== *[[King of Kings Tournament 1999]] (Oct 28, 1999 – Feb 26, 2000) – [[Dan Henderson]] *King of Kings Tournament 2000 (Oct 9, 2000 – Feb 24, 2001) – [[Antônio Rodrigo Nogueira]] ===Title Tournaments=== *Light Heavyweight Title Tournament 1997 (Mar 28 – Aug 13, 1997) – [[Masayuki Naruse]] *Middleweight Title Tournament 2001 (Apr 20 – Aug 11, 2001) – [[Ricardo Arona]] *Open-weight Title Tournament 2001 (Apr 20 – Aug 11, 2001) – [[Fedor Emelianenko]] ===Other Tournaments=== *Rising Stars Heavyweight Tournament 2000 (Jul 15 – Sep 30, 2000) – [[Bobby Hoffman]] *Rising Stars Middleweight Tournament 2000 (Jul 15 – Sep 30, 2000) – [[Jeremy Horn]] *Absolute Class Tournament 2001 (Oct 20, 2001 – Feb 15, 2002) – [[Fedor Emelianenko]] ==Championships== ===Open-Weight Championship=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:99%; text-align:center;" |- ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:1%;"|No. ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:19%;"|Name ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:15%;"|Date ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Location ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Notes |- |align=center |'''1''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Kiyoshi Tamura]]
{{small|(def. Mikhail Illoukhine)}} |January 21, 1998
{{small|(Mega Battle Tournament 1997)}} |[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] | |- |align=center |'''2''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|Georgia|1990}} Tariel Bitsadze
{{small|(def. Kiyoshi Tamura)}} |May 29, 1998
{{small|(Fighting Integration III)}} |[[Sapporo]], [[Japan]] | |- |align=center |'''3''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Kiyoshi Tamura]]
{{small|(def. Tariel Bitsadze)}} |May 22, 1999
{{small|(Rise III)}} |[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] | |- |align=center |'''4''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|NED}} [[Gilbert Yvel]]
{{small|(def. Kiyoshi Tamura)}} |April 20, 2000
{{small|(Millennium Combine)}} |[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] |{{small|Title was vacated in May 2000 when Yvel signed to [[Pride FC]].}} |- |align=center |'''5''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|RUS}} [[Fedor Emelianenko]]
{{small|(def. Renato Sobral)}} |August 11, 2001
{{small|(10th Anniversary)}} |[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] | |- |} ===Light-Heavyweight Championship (−{{convert|95|kg|lb|1|abbr=on}})=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:99%; text-align:center;" |- ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:1%;"|No. ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:19%;"|Name ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:15%;"|Date ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Location ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Notes |- |align=center |'''1''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|JPN}} [[Masayuki Naruse]]
{{small|(def. Christopher Haseman)}} |August 13, 1997
{{small|(Fighting Extension VI)}} |[[Kagoshima]], [[Japan]] |Title Dissolved. |} ===Middleweight Championship (−{{convert|80|kg|lb|1|abbr=on}})=== {| class="wikitable" style="width:99%; text-align:center;" |- ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:1%;"|No. ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:19%;"|Name ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:15%;"|Date ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Location ! style="background:#e3e3e3; width:20%;"|Notes |- |align=center |'''1''' |align="left"|{{flagicon|BRA}} [[Ricardo Arona]]
{{small|(def. Gustavo Ximu)}} |August 11, 2001
{{small|(Rings-10th Anniversary)}} |[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] |Promotion closed on February 15, 2002. |} ==Japanese roster== *[[Akira Maeda]] *[[Mitsuya Nagai]] *[[Yoshihisa Yamamoto (wrestler)|Yoshihisa Yamamoto]] *[[Masayuki Naruse]] *[[Tsuyoshi Kosaka]] *[[Wataru Sakata]] *[[Kiyoshi Tamura]] *[[Kenichi Yamamoto (mixed martial artist)|Kenichi Yamamoto]] *[[Hiromitsu Kanehara]] *[[Ryuki Ueyama]] *Hiroyuki Ito *Yoshinori Nishi ==Foreigners== RINGS' system was largely much inspired by organizations such as the [[National Wrestling Alliance]] and [[FIFA]], and featured fighters from different countries organized into [[Stable (disambiguation)|stables]]. These foreign fighters would then compete against RINGS' Japanese competitors and against each other. ===Stables=== *{{flagicon|NED}} [[Netherlands]] – [[Dick Vrij]], [[Hans Nijman]], [[Gilbert Yvel]], [[Joop Kasteel]], [[Bob Schrijber]], [[Valentijn Overeem]], [[Alistair Overeem]], [[Chris Dolman]]. *{{flagicon|AUS}} [[Australia]] – [[Chris Haseman]], [[Elvis Sinosic]]. *{{flagicon|BUL}} [[Bulgaria]] – Todor Todorov, Dimitar Petkov, [[Georgi Tonkov]]. *{{flagicon|Georgia|1990}} [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] – [[Zaza Tkeshelashvili]], [[Tariel Bitsadze]], Amiran Bitsadze. *{{flagicon|RUS}} [[Russia]] – [[Fedor Emelianenko]], [[Andrei Kopylov]], [[Bazigit Atajev]], Nikolai Zuyev, [[Mikhail Illoukhine]], [[Volk Han]]. *{{flagicon|BRA}} [[Brazil]] – [[Antônio Rodrigo Nogueira]], [[Ricardo Arona]], [[Renato Sobral]], [[Gustavo Machado]], [[Renzo Gracie]]. *{{flagicon|UK}} [[United Kingdom]] – [[Lee Hasdell]], Chris Watts, Dexter Casey and [[Paul Cahoon]]. *{{flagicon|USA}} [[United States]] – [[Randy Couture]], [[Dan Henderson]], [[Kerry Schall]], [[Bobby Hoffman]]. ==Decline== Maeda retired from active duty in 1998, leaving Tamura as the top star, but the collapse of [[UWF International]] and the subsequent rise of [[Pride Fighting Championships|PRIDE]] provided competition that proved to be too much for the promotion. On February 15, 2002, RINGS ceased activity.{{cite web|url=http://www.daily.co.jp/ring/2006/12/22/0000198179.shtml|script-title=ja:前田日明 07年リングス再始動へ|language=Japanese|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080110223724/http://www.daily.co.jp/ring/2006/12/22/0000198179.shtml|archivedate=January 10, 2008|deadurl=yes}} Many Japanese RINGS stars, including [[Masayuki Naruse]], [[Wataru Sakata]] and Hiroyuki Ito, made the transition back into [[puroresu]]. The MMA promotion [[ZST]] was founded in November 2002 to accommodate former Japanese RINGS fighters who remained competitors in mixed martial arts. ==Revival== Following the dissolution of [[Hero's]] and the conclusion of Maeda's involvement with FEG, Maeda revived the RINGS brand for a new series of MMA events named ''The Outsider''. The first ''RINGS The Outsider'' event occurred on March 30, 2008. Over a dozen Outsider events have been held since.{{cite web|url=http://www.sherdog.com/fightfinder.php?organization_id=10 |title=UFC, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) News, Results, Fighting |publisher=Sherdog.com |date= |accessdate=2013-10-06}} The brand was resurrected once more on January 22, 2012 with Battle Genesis: Vol. 9, Volume 8 took place on September 20, 2001. The event was sanctioned by fellow mixed martial arts promotion ZST.[http://blog.livedoor.jp/zst_info/archives/1947680.html 2012年 ZST・RINGS スケジュール] ==See also== {{Portal|MMA|Professional wrestling|Japan}} * [[List of Fighting Network Rings events]] ==References== ==External links== *[http://www.sherdog.com/organizations/Rings-10 Rings event results at Sherdog] {{MMA organizations}} {{Professional wrestling in Japan}} [[Category:Japanese professional wrestling promotions]] [[Category:Mixed martial arts organizations]] [[Category:Sports organisations established in 1991]] [[Category:1991 establishments in Japan]]

{{Infobox film | name = Floating Melon | image = Fu Guo - Floating Melon Poster International (dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi).jpg | image_size = 215px | alt = | caption = Floating Melon (Fu Guo) English Poster | director = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | producer = Leng Zhiwen | writer = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | starring = Vincent Chen Xi
Celia Yu Yinmeng
Wen Sirui
Xu Xu
Ariel Pei Zimu
Li Wen
Maggie Xue Zhu | music = [[Andrea Centazzo]] | cinematography = Guo Yong | editing = [[Roberto F. Canuto]]
[[Xu Xiaoxi]] | studio = Almost Red Productions | released = {{Film date|2015|11|27|53 Gijon Int. Film Festival}} | runtime = 19 minutes | country = China
Spain | language = Mandarin
Sichuanese Dialect | budget = }} {{Commons category|Floating Melon}} '''''Floating Melon''''' (Original {{zh|s= 浮果|t=浮果|p='''Fu Guo'''|l=floating fruit}}; Spanish title '''''Sandía amarga''''') is a 2015 Spanish and Chinese [[International co-production|co-production]] [[drama film]] [[written]] and [[Film director|directed]] by [[Roberto F. Canuto]] and [[Xu Xiaoxi]]. It is a low budget independent short movie produced by ''Almost Red Productions'' (China) in association with ''Arkadín Ediciones'' (Spain). It was shot in [[Chengdu]] (China), using the local dialect of the region, the [[Sichuanese Mandarin]]. The film has a strong [[film noir]] influences and represents the second part of the work ''Invisible Chengdu'', a [[trilogy]] that focuses on characters that usually are kept underground and discriminated in the Chinese society and often not well represented in the [[Movie theater|silver screen]]. The first part is the film ''[[Ni Jing: Thou Shalt Not Steal]]'' (2013) and the last part [[Sunken Plum]] (to be released in 2017).{{cite news|title=Roberto F. Canuto finaliza un nuevo rodaje en China con el director Xu Xiaoxi (Roberto F. Canuto finishes a new shoot in China with the director Xu Xiaoxi)|url=http://www.lne.es/gijon/2016/10/11/roberto-f-canuto-finaliza-nuevo/1996053.html|accessdate=10 December 2016|publisher=La Nueva España (newspaper), Spain|date=11 October 2016|language=Spanish}} ''Floating Melon'' is performed by non professional actors and it includes themes very delicate, often censured in China, specially the representation of the homosexuality in young people, a community that need to protect themselves due to the lack of protective laws in the country. The story is partially based in true events, but the atmosphere is close to the [[Film Noir]] genre, to reflect the only situation where [[queer]] people can express themselves, community that needs to live in the shadows of the night in the Chinese society.{{cite AV media | people =Alderiques d'asturies| date =9 December 2016| title =53 FICX – Nacho Carballo y Día d’Asturies (asturian)| trans-title =53 FICX - Nacho Carballo y Dia de Asturias | medium =Video interview| language =Spanish| url =http://www.alderiquesdasturies.com/53-ficx-nacho-carballo-y-dia-dasturies/| access-date =10 December 2016 | time =minutes:10}} It tells the story of ''Xiao Cheng'', a young Chinese guy that ask for help to a friend to resolve a big trouble, the guy with whom he spend the afternoon is dead on his bed from the effect of a drug, not something the Chinese authorities look kindly on.{{cite web|title=Floating Melon |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5191784|website=IMDB|accessdate=10 December 2016}} The film [[premiere]]d in Spain at the 53rd ''[[Gijon International Film Festival|FICXIXON, Gijón International Film Festival]]'' in November 2015 and in China at the Art Gallery ''Shujingtang Alley Art Space'' in Chengdu (Sichuan) in June 2016. It received an '''Audience Award''' at the 15th ''Aviles Acción Film Festival'' (Spain){{cite web|title=Premios 2016 (awards 2016)|url=http://www.avilesaccion.com/premios-2016/|website=Avilés Acción Film Festival Website|publisher=Avilés Acción Film Festival|accessdate=10 December 2016|language=Spanish}} and the '''Audience Choice Award''' and '''Best Cinematography Award''' ('''Guo Yong''') at the III ''Asturian Film Festival of Proaza'' 2016 (Spain).{{cite web|title=Awards Floating Melon|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5191784/awards|website=IMDB|accessdate=10 December 2016}} In the first 12 months after the release it has been presented in over 40 international film festivals in Europe, America, Asia and Africa.{{cite web|title=Floating Melon Release Info |url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5191784/releaseinfo?ref_=tt_ov_inf|website=IMDB|accessdate=10 December 2016}} ==Plot== For the young Xiao Cheng (Vincent Cheng Xi), what supposes to be a perfect night becomes a nightmare. His lover, Kwan Ming (Xu Xu) seems dead after a lethal drug reaction. In the dark roads of Chengdu, Xiao Cheng, scared of the consequences, send a message asking for help to his friend Fiona (Wen Sirui). She comes to meet him with her girlfriend Lola (Celia Yu Yunmeng), that doesn’t want to get involve with the problem. Fiona thinks that the best solution is to hide the body, but when they return to the apartment, they found the unexpected. ==Cast== * Vincent Chen Xi ({{zh|c=陈熙}}) as Cheng Xi * Celia Yu Yinmeng ({{zh|c=余吟萌}}) as Lola Liu * Wen Sirui ({{zh|c=文思睿}}) as Fiona Wu * Xu Xu ({{zh|c=徐徐}}) as Kwan Ming * Ariel Pei Zimu ({{zh|c=裴梓慕}}) as Girl in the street * Li Wen ({{zh|c=李文}}) as Guy in the street * Maggie Xue Zhu ({{zh|c=薛竹}}) as Woman in a bar ==Production & Directors Commentary == '''''Floating Melon (Fu Guo)''''' was shot in Chengdu (China). The principal photography took place in September 2015 and the post-production was completed in October 2015. It was produced by ''Almost Red Productions'' (company owned by the directors in China) in association with the Spanish company ''Arkadin Ediciones''. [[File:Floating Melon Still pic 2 (Fu Guo, Sandia Amarga, dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi) with Wen Sirui and Vincent Chen Xi.jpg|thumb|left|Scene of Floating Melon (Fu Guo) in [[Chengdu]], [[China]], with Vincent Chen Xi and Wen Sirui.]] According to the directors, the main difficulty in the production was the casting. "It was complicated to find a group of suitable actor that were interested in play gay characters and also were not scared of play some explicit scenes. Finally we collaborate with non professional actors. Also the production maintained a low profile to avoid the strong censhorship laws in China." {{cite web|author1=Miss Bang (Miss邦)|title=成都的电影入围了3个国际大奖 是这个成都人和这个西班牙人拍的 (A film made in Chengdu win 3 awards)|url=http://www.yidianzixun.com/as/0DuPwVrK|website=yidianzixun.com (Chinese Website)|accessdate=10 December 2016|language=Chinese|date=15 July 2016|quote="电影里的所有演员皆非专业，不选专业演员，是因为没有选到合适的。“我们花了大量时间去培训演员，但我们不会限定演员的表演方式，比如表现悲伤，每个人悲伤的方式都不一样，我们不需要告诉演员怎么演，只需要告诉他，他所扮演的角色为什么悲伤。"}} The directors comment about the film in these terms: ''Floating Melon is a fiction film, but inspired by characters that are present in the Chinese contemporary society.{{cite web|title=内地同志题材短片《浮果》入围西班牙希洪电影节 (The Chinese gay film "Fu Guo" nominated in Gijon, Spain)|url=http://www.danlan.org/disparticle_52456.htm|website=Danlan Website|accessdate=10 December 2016|language=Chinese|date=17 December 2015}} It reflects, with a film “noir genre” perspective in stylistic and narrative terms, the story of a young guy that cannot react in a situation that is beyond his imaginations. He needs to take a decision that will risk his future, consequence of the strict rules of the society, since he is surrounded by the confusion present on some of members of the young gay Chinese community, with no moral referents apart from the official doctrine. [[File:Floating Melon Still pic 3 (Fu Guo, Sandia Amarga, dir. Roberto F. Canuto & Xu Xiaoxi) with Vincent Chen Xi.jpg|thumb|right|Picture of Floating Melon (Fu Guo) with Vincent Chen Xi, Cinematography Guo Yong.]] The representation of the characters is very close to reality and their reactions towards the situations reflect the Chinese society of these days. Also it represents this invisible community, the LGBT, that it is not as persecuted as in other countries, but for family pressures and the lack of protective laws, it need to be self protected. This lack of referents make for some people to take unusual and in occasions dangerous routes to build their relationships.'' {{cite book|author1=Almost Red Productions|title=Floating Melon Pressbook English|date=20 November 2015|publisher=Issuu web|pages=5|url=https://issuu.com/almostredproductions/docs/floating_melon__fu_guo__pressbook_e|accessdate=10 December 2016}} ==Music== ''Floating Melon'' original soundtrack is composed by [[Andrea Centazzo]]. The collaboration between the directors and the composer started in 2008. "Floating melon'' being the fifth collaboration, following [[Ni Jing: Thou Shalt Not Steal]], [[Mei Mei]], [[Toto Forever]] and [[Desire Street (film)|Desire Street]]. According to the directors, "Fu Guo soundtrack is created from the point of view of the main character, Xiaoxi Cheng. The music guides the emotional journey of the character through the film, following the first moments of horror and confusion, until the last part, where bring us a more nostalgic atmosphere. Centazzo composed some experimental tracks for the beginning sequences, mixing sound effects, electronic music and real instruments. As the story advance, he creates some melodic themes, with guitar and saxophone as the main instruments. The music is essential to understand the evolution of the main character and to understand the meaning of the story.”{{cite book|author1=Almost Red Productions|title=Floating Melon Pressbook English|date=20 November 2015|publisher=Issuu web|pages=9|url=https://issuu.com/almostredproductions/docs/floating_melon__fu_guo__pressbook_e|accessdate=10 December 2016}} == Reception == The short film was well received in the different film festivals and events where it was screened.{{cite web|title=內地同志題材短片"浮果"入圍西班牙希洪電影節 (Mainland Chinese Gay Film goes to Gijon Film Festival)|url=http://www.2girl.net/article-15785-1.html|website=2girl.net (Chinese Website)|accessdate=10 December 2016|language=Chinese|date=20 December 2015|quote=浮果》(Floating Melon)入選2015年第53屆西班牙希洪國際電影節的短片競賽單元，放映後深受好評。The film "Floating Melon" well received in the presentation in Gijón.}} In the first year at the festival circuit, it was presented in over 40 international festivals and received some awards. The world premiere of the film we held in Spain, at the '''53rd [[Gijon International Film Festival]]''' in November 2015.{{cite web|title=Sandia Amarga|url=http://www.gijonfilmfestival.com/from/15404/peliculas/show/8088-sandia-amarga|website=Gijon international Film Festival|accessdate=10 December 2016}} It received the audience award for best short film, Asturian section, at the 15th [http://www.avilesaccion.com Aviles Action Film Festival] {{cite web|title=Premios 2016 (Awards 2016)|url=http://www.avilesaccion.com/premios-2016/|website=Aviles Accion|accessdate=10 December 2016}} and at the Audience Choice Award for Best Film and Best Cinematography at the 3rd Asturian Film Festival of Proaza.{{cite web|title=Awards Floating Melon|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt5191784/awards|website=IMDB|accessdate=10 December 2016}} In China the film premiere was held at an art gallery, '''''Shujingtang Alley Art Space''''' in Chengdu in June 12, 2016 and the reactions where very positive.{{cite web|title=Floating Melon Film Premiere|url=http://zaomengshe.com/c/319682|website=Zaomengshe Website (China)|accessdate=10 December 2016|language=Chinese & English|date=12 June 2016}} The premier in China was held relatively underground (due to the censorship laws of the country). ==Awards and screenings== :(Awards won are '''in bold''') * '''Best Short Film''' [[Audience Award]], Asturian Section ''[http://www.avilesaccion.com/premios-2016/ Avilés Acción Film Festival], 2016, Spain''{{cite web |title=Awards Floating Melon|url=https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2940138/awards|website=IMDB|accessdate=31 July 2014}} * '''Best Short Film''' [[Audience Award]], ''Festival de Cine Asturianu de Proaza 2016 (Asturian Film Festival)'' * '''Best Cinematography''' (Guo Yong) - III ''Festival de Cine Asturianu de Proaza 2016 (Asturian Film Festival)'' ≈≈SCREENINGS≈≈ * '''Spain''': ** 53rd ''[[Gijon International Film Festival]]'' (Asturias, Spain) [http://www.gijonfilmfestival.com/from/15404/peliculas/show/8088-sandia-amarga In competition] ** 21st ''[[LesGaiCineMad]]'', Madrid (Spain) [http://www.lesgaicinemad.com/2016/10/24/fu-guo-floating-melon/ In competition] ** 13th [http://zinegoak.com Zinegoak, Bilbao International GLT Film Festival] ([[Basque Country (autonomous community)|Basque Country]], Spain) [http://www.zinegoak.com/ZINEGOAK_2016.pdf In competition] ** 15th [http://www.avilesaccion.com Avilés Acción Film Festival] (Spain) [http://www.avilesaccion.com/seccion-asturias-2016/ In Competition asturias section] ** 16th [http://santjoanfestivaldecine.es Film Festival of Sant Joan d'Alacant] (Spain) [http://santjoanfestivaldecine.es/finalistas/ Finalist] ** 12th [http://www.andalesgai.com Andalesgai], LGBT Int. Film Festival of Andalucia, Seville (España) [http://www.andalesgai.com/index.php/programacion-2016/cortometrajes In Competition] ** 11th [http://zinentiendo.org/es/zinentiendo-2016/ Zinentiendo], Muestra Int. de Cine LGTBQI de Zaragoza (España) [http://zinentiendo.org/es/2016/05/30/fu-gou-floating-melon-sandia-amarga/ Muestra] ** 20th [http://webs.ono.com/cine-lafila/fest.htm/ La Fila], Short Film Festival of Valladolid (Spain) [http://webs.ono.com/cine-lafila/selecc.htm In Competition] ** 3rd Asturian Film Festival of Proaza (Spain) [http://lavozdeltrubia.es/2016/04/23/once-cortos-y-cuatro-videoclips-compiten-hoy-en-el-certamen-de-cine-asturiano/ In Competition] *'''Rest of Europe''' ** 19th [http://rozefilmdagen.nl Roze Filmdagen], Amsterdam LGBTQ Int. Film Festival (The Netherlands) [http://rozefilmdagen.nl/programma/17/our-day-will-come In Competition] ** 17th Queer Film Festival [[Mezipatra]], Prague and Brno (Czech Republic)
